episodes.title: "Jehovah's Witnesses TOOK HIS LAND & Barred Him From His MOTHER'S FUNERAL": Mchilampondo Pt 1
episodes.description:
In episode 3 of the JW Africa Series, I have a fascinating conversation with a fellow ex Jehovah's Witness based in Zambia - Mchilampondo Mapulanga. In part 1 of this conversation, Mchilampondo relates how the JWs tried to recruit him when he was 11, how his mum got into a difficult marriage with a former Circuit Overseer and how the JWs would laugh at his prayers. Mchilampondo also relates a story of the JWs barring a man who had donated his land to the JW religion from attending his JW mum's funeral. 

#jehovahswitnesses #africanjws #zambia

episodes.title: "Gilead Graduate FALSELY Accused Me of Being GAY": Michael Sinkolongo Interview Pt. 2
episodes.description:
Episode 2 of the "JW Africa Series" is the second part of my conversation with a long time friend, former school mate and fellow ex-JW activist, Michael Sinkolongo, who I shunned for several years after he left the Jehovah's Witnesses religion. Michael relates how our former schoolmate Kena Kunda, who is now a Gilead graduate, maliciously spread information that Michael had revealed in confidence to a couple of elders to non-Jehovah's Witnesses, including Michael's non-Jehovah's Witness boss. Michael also relates how the Gilead graduate was involved in spreading a false rumour about Michael being gay. Michael discusses how aspects of the Jehovah's Witnesses New World Translation Bible proved to him that the religion was not true. Michael and I discuss why it is important to be open-minded in matters of religion.

Michael is a prolific writer and has published, among other things, books related to his experiences in the Jehovah's Witnesses' religion.

Michael's book "What If We Are Wrong" can be read here for FREE: https://michaelsinkolongo.kundananjicreations.com/pages/files/what-if-we-are-wrong.pdf

episodes.title: Jehovah's Witnesses' Leadership INTERFERES In ONGOING ELECTIONS with @NewyorkerRican
episodes.description:
The Jehovah's Witnesses' leadership are doubling down on their prohibition against participating in any form of politics (voting, running for office, campaigning, lobbying, discussing politics and even thinking about politics!). This could well and truly be considered election interference. But can a Jehovah's Witness be officially shunned for voting in an election? Ruby ( @NewyorkerRican   ) and I dig into a 1999 Watchtower (https://wol.jw.org/en/wol/d/r1/lp-e/1999807#h=1:0-15:471) that discusses this question. We also go through the elders' manual (Shepherd the Flock of God) to ascertain whether voting in an election is an offense punishable by shunning.

episodes.title: Are Jehovah's Witnesses About to Scrap the "Disassociation" Policy?
episodes.description:
In this video, I recap on the updates to the Jehovah's Witnesses shunning policy and discuss why the Governing Body have up until now not provided any updates to the "disassociation" policy. I explain why we can expect updates to this policy at the 2024 Annual meeting and what that new policy would look like. I also show a clip from a recent episode of Bart Ehrman's "Misquoting Jesus" podcast in which Dr Ehrman criticises the Jehovah's Witnesses shunning policy. 

Bart Ehrman's full episode can be seen here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=il9D90R4Myk

The Jehovah's Witnesses leadership have a ZERO TOLERANCE policy towards any and all criticism directed at them. This video montage demonstrates how the leaders hypocritically expect ordinary Jehovah's Witnesses to humbly accept and implement criticism, while at the same time totally rejecting valid criticisms both from members and people outside the religion.

episodes.title: Massive Bible Translation Error That Jehovah's Witnesses Governing Body Are Covering Up
episodes.description:
The Israelites are said to have crossed the "Red Sea" on dry land while escaping from their Egyptian overlords and en route to the promised land. But is this what really happened? What do scholars say about the Hebrew phrase that Bible translators routinely render as "Red Sea"? And what does the cover up of this translation error say about the Jehovah's Witnesses leadership? I discuss these questions in detail in this video.

Dr Christine Hayes' full lecture can be seen here: https://oyc.yale.edu/religious-studies/rlst-145/lecture-8

The full Misquoting Jesus episode with Dr Bart Ehrman and Dr Jennifer Knust on Bible translation processes can be seen here: https://youtu.be/j5hSIsMnxxY?si=YAR061I-tzgecqwC

episodes.title: August 2024 Watchtower Released: Marking (Soft Shunning) Policy Scrapped
episodes.description:
The much speculated about August 2024 Watchtower study edition is finally due to be released. Unsurprisingly, this edition of the magazine regurgitates the contents of the 2024 Governing Body Update #2 and the March 15 2024 letter to Jehovah's Witnesses elders, which dealt with some superficial changes to the organisation's shunning policies. In an unexpected turn, the "Questions From Readers" article in the issue effectively scraps the official soft shunning policy internally referred to as "marking disorderly ones." Arthur Weber and I discuss these matters in detail in the video.

We comment on 12 points from the convention that seem to indicate the direction the religion is going into. episodes.title: What's In The Mysterious August 2024 Watchtower?
episodes.description:
Rather bizarrely, the Jehovah's Witnesses leadership have failed to publish the August 2024 issue of their flagship magazine, the Watchtower. True to form, they have opted not to be upfront with their members and have secretly informed the elders that the September and October 2024 issues of the Watchtower will be published prior to the August issue (as per the S-147 announcements for June 2024). Arthur and I discuss why we do not expect this Watchtower issue to have any new doctrines and / or policies and what we expect to see in it.

episodes.description:

In the "Big Issue" segment, Chaka takes issue with this reckless advice, while Ruby takes issue with the Governing Body producing endless propaganda material that leads people astray. This episode begins with Ruby's rendition of the Jehovah's Witnesses song 127 "The Sort of Person I Should Be". The episode contains a highlight reel from Ruby's Alternative Watchtower Study that can be viewed on Ruby's channel.

episodes.title: Vol 1 Ep 1: Did Moses Really Write The Pentateuch?
episodes.description:
Moses is traditionally attributed as the author of the Pentateuch (Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Number and Deuteronomy). But did Moses really write these books? What does the Bible's internal evidence suggest? And what do scholars have to say on this subject. Join Chaka as he delves into this fascinating and intriguing subject.

The uhHoly Bible Project is available in podcast format on your favourite podcast listening app.

Future episodes of this show will be posted on this channel: https://youtube.com/@unHolyBibleProject?si=sQHkvdQP5DhI3hw_

The slides used in this presentation are available here: https://anthonymorrisreturns.jwinfo.ro/files/unHoly%20Bible%20Project%20Episode%201.pptx

You can view the Open Yale Introduction To Hebrew Bible Course Here: https://oyc.yale.edu/religious-studies/rlst-145

You can view the Open Yale Introduction to New Testament Course Here: https://oyc.yale.edu/religious-studies/rlst-152

You can view view the Yale Hebrew Bible Interpretation lectures here: https://youtu.be/OZIm_edPz20?si=n5y1z92Vl87p1g59

#bible #scholarship #pentateuch 

This show is for anyone who has an interest in the historical and critical reading of the Bible, whether they are people of faith or not. The unHoly Bible project is a multiyear project in which I take a critical look at the stories, events and other content found in the Bible. I go through this content in the order they are presented in the Bible, starting from the first Chapter of Genesis right through to the last chapter of Revelation. While I am not a Biblical scholar, I will be discussing this material through the lens of the scholarly consensus.

episodes.title: Jehovah's Witnesses Treat Suicide As Crime: Victims Barred From Having Kingdom Hall Funeral
episodes.description:
In this video I comment on the discussions about suicide in chapters 12, 15, 2 and 1 of the Jehovah's Witnesses elders' manual "Shepherd the Flock of God". I show that the Jehovah's Witnesses leadership view suicide as a crime and a sin and offer no practical support to victims and their families. I highlight how victims are barred from having their funeral in a Kingdom Hall and that elders are effectively instructed to not perform funerals for suicide victims. I appeal to Jehovah's Witnesses who directly or indirectly struggle with mental health difficulties to reflect on the religion's attitude towards this serious problem.

#jehovahswitnesses #exjw #mentalhealth
